feed.title: MARINKA ZITNIK
feed.subtitle: Machine Learning for Medicine and Science

entry.title: Deep Contextual Learners for Protein Networks

link.title: Deep Contextual Learners for Protein Networks

entry.content: New preprint on contextualized protein embeddings aims to characterize genes with disease-specific interactions and elucidate disease manifestation in specific cell types.
entry.summary: New preprint on contextualized protein embeddings aims to characterize genes with disease-specific interactions and elucidate disease manifestation in specific cell types.

entry.title: New Paper Accepted at UAI
entry.content: Our unified framework for fair and stable graph representation learning has just been accepted at UAI. We establish a theoretical connection between counterfactual fairness and stability and use it in a framework that can be used with any GNN to learn fair and stable embeddings.
entry.summary: Our unified framework for fair and stable graph representation learning has just been accepted at UAI. We establish a theoretical connection between counterfactual fairness and stability and use it in a framework that can be used with any GNN to learn fair and stable embeddings.

entry.title: Hot Off the Press: COVID-19 Repurposing in PNAS

link.title: Hot Off the Press: COVID-19 Repurposing in PNAS

entry.content: Hot off the press! We deployed AI/ML and network medicine algorithms to rank 6,340 drugs for their expected efficacy against SARS-CoV-2. We screened in human cells the top-ranked drugs, identifying six drugs that reduced viral infection, four of which could be repurposed to treat COVID-19.
entry.summary: Hot off the press! We deployed AI/ML and network medicine algorithms to rank 6,340 drugs for their expected efficacy against SARS-CoV-2. We screened in human cells the top-ranked drugs, identifying six drugs that reduced viral infection, four of which could be repurposed to treat COVID-19.

entry.title: Representation Learning for Biomedical Nets
entry.content: In our survey on representation learning for biomedical networks we discuss how long-standing principles of network biology and medicine provide the conceptual grounding for representation learning, explain its successes, and inform future advances.
entry.summary: In our survey on representation learning for biomedical networks we discuss how long-standing principles of network biology and medicine provide the conceptual grounding for representation learning, explain its successes, and inform future advances.

entry.title: Receiving Amazon Research Award
entry.content: We are excited about receiving Amazon Faculty Research Award on Actionable Graph Learning for Finding Cures for Emerging Diseases. Thank you to Amazon Science for supporting our research.
entry.summary: We are excited about receiving Amazon Faculty Research Award on Actionable Graph Learning for Finding Cures for Emerging Diseases. Thank you to Amazon Science for supporting our research.

entry.title: Michelle’s Graduate Research Fellowship
entry.content: Michelle M. Li won the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Award. Congratulations!
entry.summary: Michelle M. Li won the NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Award. Congratulations!

entry.title: Graph Networks in Computational Biology
entry.content: We are excited to share slides from our recent lecture on Graph Neural Networks in Computational Biology, which we gave at Stanford ML for Graphs course.
entry.summary: We are excited to share slides from our recent lecture on Graph Neural Networks in Computational Biology, which we gave at Stanford ML for Graphs course.

entry.title: Hot Off the Press: Multiscale Interactome

link.title: Hot Off the Press: Multiscale Interactome

entry.content: Hot off the press! We develop a multiscale interactome approach to explain disease treatments. The approach can predict drug-disease treatments, identify proteins and biological functions related to treatment, and identify genes that alter treatment’s efficacy and adverse reactions.
entry.summary: Hot off the press! We develop a multiscale interactome approach to explain disease treatments. The approach can predict drug-disease treatments, identify proteins and biological functions related to treatment, and identify genes that alter treatment’s efficacy and adverse reactions.

entry.title: Fair and Stable Graph Representation Learning

link.title: Fair and Stable Graph Representation Learning

entry.content: We are thrilled to share the latest preprint on fair and stable graph representation learning.
entry.summary: We are thrilled to share the latest preprint on fair and stable graph representation learning.

entry.title: New Preprint on Therapeutics Data Commons

link.title: New Preprint on Therapeutics Data Commons

entry.content: We are excited to share the preprint on Therapeutics Data Commons: Machine Learning Datasets and Tasks for Therapeutics. TDC is available at http://tdcommons.ai.
entry.summary: We are excited to share the preprint on Therapeutics Data Commons: Machine Learning Datasets and Tasks for Therapeutics. TDC is available at http://tdcommons.ai.
